Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM INSIDE-BARROW (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are inside an ancient barrow hidden deep within a dark forest.
The barrow opens into a narrow tunnel at its southern end. You can
see a faint glow at the far end.") (DESC "Inside the Barrow") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (SOUTH TO NARROW-TUNNEL) (OUT "You may not recall, but when you entered, the door of the barrow
shut behind you. There is no way out."))
Name: INSIDE-BARROW

OUT.MESSAGE:
You may not recall, but when you entered, the door of the barrow
shut behind you. There is no way out.
OUT.Zil:
(OUT "You may not recall, but when you entered, the door of the barrow
shut behind you. There is no way out.")

LDESC:
You are inside an ancient barrow hidden deep within a dark forest.
The barrow opens into a narrow tunnel at its southern end. You can
see a faint glow at the far end.
OUT:
You may not recall, but when you entered, the door of the barrow
shut behind you. There is no way out.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM NARROW-TUNNEL (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are standing at the southern end of a narrow tunnel where it opens
into a wide cavern. The cavern is dimly illuminated by phosphorescent
mosses clinging to its high ceiling. A deep ravine winds through the
cavern, with a small stream at the bottom. The walls of the ravine are
steep and crumbly. A foot bridge crosses the ravine to the south.") (DESC "Narrow Tunnel") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (NORTH TO INSIDE-BARROW) (SOUTH TO FOOT-BRIDGE) (CROSS TO FOOT-BRIDGE) (DOWN "As you start down, you slip on the crumbling
rocks and pull back, narrowly averting a fatal fall.") (GLOBAL BRIDGE CHASM STREAM MOSS))
Name: NARROW-TUNNEL

DOWN.MESSAGE:
As you start down, you slip on the crumbling
rocks and pull back, narrowly averting a fatal fall.
DOWN.Zil:
(DOWN "As you start down, you slip on the crumbling
rocks and pull back, narrowly averting a fatal fall.")

LDESC:
You are standing at the southern end of a narrow tunnel where it opens
into a wide cavern. The cavern is dimly illuminated by phosphorescent
mosses clinging to its high ceiling. A deep ravine winds through the
cavern, with a small stream at the bottom. The walls of the ravine are
steep and crumbly. A foot bridge crosses the ravine to the south.
DOWN:
As you start down, you slip on the crumbling
rocks and pull back, narrowly averting a fatal fall.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM FOOT-BRIDGE (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are standing on a crude but sturdy wooden foot bridge crossing a
deep ravine. The path runs north and south from here.") (DESC "Foot Bridge") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (NORTH TO NARROW-TUNNEL) (SOUTH TO GREAT-CAVERN) (DOWN "The drop would be fatal.") (CROSS "You'll have to specify a direction.") (GLOBAL BRIDGE CHASM))
Name: FOOT-BRIDGE

CROSS.MESSAGE: You'll have to specify a direction.

LDESC:
You are standing on a crude but sturdy wooden foot bridge crossing a
deep ravine. The path runs north and south from here.
CROSS: You'll have to specify a direction.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM GREAT-CAVERN (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the center of the great cavern, carved out of the limestone.
Stalactites and stalagmites of many sizes are everywhere. The room glows
with dim light provided by phosphorescent moss, and weird shadows move all
around you. A narrow path winds southwest among the stalagmites, and another
leads northeast.") (DESC "Great Cavern") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (NE TO FOOT-BRIDGE) (SW TO SHALLOW-FORD) (GLOBAL MOSS) (PSEUDO "STALAGMITE" STALA-PSEUDO "STALACTITE" STALA-PSEUDO))
Name: GREAT-CAVERN

LDESC:
This is the center of the great cavern, carved out of the limestone.
Stalactites and stalagmites of many sizes are everywhere. The room glows
with dim light provided by phosphorescent moss, and weird shadows move all
around you. A narrow path winds southwest among the stalagmites, and another
leads northeast.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM SHALLOW-FORD (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are at the southern edge of a great cavern. To the south across a
shallow ford is a dark tunnel which looks like it was once
enlarged and smoothed. To the north a narrow path winds among
stalagmites. Dim light illuminates the cavern.") (DESC "Shallow Ford") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (NORTH TO GREAT-CAVERN) (SOUTH TO DARK-TUNNEL) (CROSS TO DARK-TUNNEL) (GLOBAL GLOBAL-WATER))
Name: SHALLOW-FORD

LDESC:
You are at the southern edge of a great cavern. To the south across a
shallow ford is a dark tunnel which looks like it was once
enlarged and smoothed. To the north a narrow path winds among
stalagmites. Dim light illuminates the cavern.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM DARK-TUNNEL (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a dark tunnel with dim light to the northeast. The
tunnel is smooth but dusty and filled with twigs and leaves, debris
which becomes deeper as the tunnel branches into a wide corridor leading
southwest and a narrower one leading southeast.") (DESC "Dark Tunnel") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NE TO SHALLOW-FORD) (SE TO GARDEN-NORTH) (SW TO STREAM-PATH))
Name: DARK-TUNNEL

LDESC:
This is a dark tunnel with dim light to the northeast. The
tunnel is smooth but dusty and filled with twigs and leaves, debris
which becomes deeper as the tunnel branches into a wide corridor leading
southwest and a narrower one leading southeast.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM GARDEN-NORTH (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the northern end of a formal garden. Hedges hide
the cavern walls, and if you don't look up, the illusion is of a cloudy
day outside. The light comes from a large growth of glowing mosses on the
roof of the cave. A break in the hedge is almost overgrown to the north.
A carefully manicured path leads south. In the center of a rosebed is a
small open structure, painted white. It appears to be a gazebo.") (DESC "North End of Garden") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (IN TO GAZEBO-ROOM) (NORTH TO DARK-TUNNEL) (SOUTH TO FORMAL-GARDEN) (ACTION GARDEN-ROOM-FCN) (GLOBAL GLOBAL-UNICORN GAZEBO MOSS ROSE-BUSH))
Name: GARDEN-NORTH

LDESC:
This is the northern end of a formal garden. Hedges hide
the cavern walls, and if you don't look up, the illusion is of a cloudy
day outside. The light comes from a large growth of glowing mosses on the
roof of the cave. A break in the hedge is almost overgrown to the north.
A carefully manicured path leads south. In the center of a rosebed is a
small open structure, painted white. It appears to be a gazebo.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM GAZEBO-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a gazebo in the midst of a formal garden. It is cool and
restful here. A tea table adorns the center of the gazebo.") (DESC "Gazebo") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (OUT TO GARDEN-NORTH) (GLOBAL GLOBAL-UNICORN GAZEBO))
Name: GAZEBO-ROOM

LDESC:
This is a gazebo in the midst of a formal garden. It is cool and
restful here. A tea table adorns the center of the gazebo.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM FORMAL-GARDEN (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the middle part of a formal garden. Hedges hide the cavern
walls and a dim illumination comes from mosses far above.
The path is of small crushed white stones. It winds among bushes and
flower beds from south to north. To the north a small structure
can be seen. To the south are peculiarly shaped bushes.
There is a small gap in the hedges to the west.") (DESC "Formal Garden") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (WEST TO STREAM-PATH) (NORTH TO GARDEN-NORTH) (SOUTH TO TOPIARY-ROOM) (ACTION GARDEN-ROOM-FCN) (GLOBAL GLOBAL-UNICORN MOSS))
Name: FORMAL-GARDEN

LDESC:
This is the middle part of a formal garden. Hedges hide the cavern
walls and a dim illumination comes from mosses far above.
The path is of small crushed white stones. It winds among bushes and
flower beds from south to north. To the north a small structure
can be seen. To the south are peculiarly shaped bushes.
There is a small gap in the hedges to the west.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM TOPIARY-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the southern end of a formal garden. Hedges hide the cavern
walls and mosses provide dim illumination. Fantastically shaped hedges
and bushes are arrayed with geometric precision. They have not recently
been clipped, but you can discern creatures in the shapes of the bushes:
There is a dragon, a unicorn, a great serpent, a huge misshapen dog, and
several human figures. On the west side of the garden the path
leads through a rose arbor into a tunnel.") (DESC "Topiary") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (WEST TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (NORTH TO FORMAL-GARDEN) (ACTION GARDEN-ROOM-FCN) (GLOBAL GLOBAL-UNICORN MOSS ROSE-BUSH))
Name: TOPIARY-ROOM

LDESC:
This is the southern end of a formal garden. Hedges hide the cavern
walls and mosses provide dim illumination. Fantastically shaped hedges
and bushes are arrayed with geometric precision. They have not recently
been clipped, but you can discern creatures in the shapes of the bushes:
There is a dragon, a unicorn, a great serpent, a huge misshapen dog, and
several human figures. On the west side of the garden the path
leads through a rose arbor into a tunnel.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM STREAM-PATH (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "The path follows the south edge of a deep ravine and heads northeast.
A tunnel heads southwest, narrowing to a rather tight crawl. A
faint whirring sound can be heard in that direction. On the east is a
ruined archway choked with vegetation.") (DESC "Path Near Stream") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (EAST TO FORMAL-GARDEN) (NE TO DARK-TUNNEL) (SW TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (WEST TO MARBLE-HALL IF SECRET-DOOR) (DOWN "The ravine is extremely deep. You would never make it.") (GLOBAL BRIDGE CHASM STREAM))
Name: STREAM-PATH

DOWN.MESSAGE: The ravine is extremely deep. You would never make it.
DOWN.Zil: (DOWN "The ravine is extremely deep. You would never make it.")

LDESC:
The path follows the south edge of a deep ravine and heads northeast.
A tunnel heads southwest, narrowing to a rather tight crawl. A
faint whirring sound can be heard in that direction. On the east is a
ruined archway choked with vegetation.
DOWN: The ravine is extremely deep. You would never make it.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM MARBLE-HALL (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is an arched hall of fine marble. The hall stops abruptly
to the north at a ford across a stream, where the marble is cracked and
broken. Perhaps a flood or collapse of the cave was responsible. To
the south the hall opens into a large room. There is rather annoying
whirring sound coming from that room.") (DESC "Marble Hall") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (EAST TO STREAM-PATH IF SECRET-DOOR ELSE "That's a wall there.") (NORTH TO DEEP-FORD) (SOUTH TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (GLOBAL STREAM))
Name: MARBLE-HALL

EAST.Zil: (EAST TO STREAM-PATH IF SECRET-DOOR ELSE "That's a wall there.")

LDESC:
This is an arched hall of fine marble. The hall stops abruptly
to the north at a ford across a stream, where the marble is cracked and
broken. Perhaps a flood or collapse of the cave was responsible. To
the south the hall opens into a large room. There is rather annoying
whirring sound coming from that room.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM DEEP-FORD (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are fording the stream at a deep but not impossible spot. The
water is very cold. The walls of the ravine rise to east and west.
There is a small ledge along the north wall of the ravine. To the south
is the entrance to a well-constructed but somewhat ruined hall.") (DESC "Deep Ford") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO RAVINE-LEDGE) (UP TO RAVINE-LEDGE) (SOUTH TO MARBLE-HALL) (EAST "The stream deepens rapidly, and you wisely return before drowning.") (WEST "You notice that the ledge above would be a drier route west.") (GLOBAL GLOBAL-WATER CHASM STREAM))
Name: DEEP-FORD

EAST.MESSAGE: The stream deepens rapidly, and you wisely return before drowning.
EAST.Zil: (EAST "The stream deepens rapidly, and you wisely return before drowning.")

WEST.MESSAGE: You notice that the ledge above would be a drier route west.
WEST.Zil: (WEST "You notice that the ledge above would be a drier route west.")

LDESC:
You are fording the stream at a deep but not impossible spot. The
water is very cold. The walls of the ravine rise to east and west.
There is a small ledge along the north wall of the ravine. To the south
is the entrance to a well-constructed but somewhat ruined hall.
EAST: The stream deepens rapidly, and you wisely return before drowning.
WEST: You notice that the ledge above would be a drier route west.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM RAVINE-LEDGE (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are on a narrow ledge near the bottom of a deep ravine. The ledge
continues to the west. A precarious climb up to another tiny ledge is
possible. A short scramble down the rock face leads
to a stream.") (DESC "Ledge in Ravine") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (UP TO TINY-ROOM) (SOUTH TO DEEP-FORD) (WEST TO LEDGE-TUNNEL) (DOWN TO DEEP-FORD) (GLOBAL CHASM))
Name: RAVINE-LEDGE

LDESC:
You are on a narrow ledge near the bottom of a deep ravine. The ledge
continues to the west. A precarious climb up to another tiny ledge is
possible. A short scramble down the rock face leads
to a stream.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM LEDGE-TUNNEL (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "A ledge from the east ends here, and a tunnel leads north into the wall.
There is a rather odd smokey odor in the warm air of the tunnel.") (DESC "End of Ledge") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (EAST TO RAVINE-LEDGE) (IN TO DRAGON-ROOM) (NORTH TO DRAGON-ROOM) (DOWN "There are a lot of sharp rocks down there."))
Name: LEDGE-TUNNEL

DOWN.MESSAGE: There are a lot of sharp rocks down there.
DOWN.Zil: (DOWN "There are a lot of sharp rocks down there.")

LDESC:
A ledge from the east ends here, and a tunnel leads north into the wall.
There is a rather odd smokey odor in the warm air of the tunnel.
DOWN: There are a lot of sharp rocks down there.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM DRAGON-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "The room is a large cavern full of broken stone. The walls are
scorched and there are deep scratches on the floor. A sooty dry smell
is very strong here. A paved path winds from a large passage to the
west, through the room, and across a huge stone bridge
to the south. To the east a small crack is visible. A dark and
smokey tunnel leads north.") (DESC "Dragon Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (EAST TO LEDGE-TUNNEL) (NORTH TO DRAGON-LAIR IF ICE-MELTED ELSE "The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.") (IN TO DRAGON-LAIR IF ICE-MELTED ELSE "The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.") (WEST TO FRESCO-ROOM) (SOUTH TO STONE-BRIDGE) (CROSS TO STONE-BRIDGE) (GLOBAL BRIDGE))
Name: DRAGON-ROOM

NORTH.ELSE: The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.
NORTH.Zil: (NORTH TO DRAGON-LAIR IF ICE-MELTED ELSE "The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.")

IN.ELSE: The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.
IN.Zil: (IN TO DRAGON-LAIR IF ICE-MELTED ELSE "The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.")

LDESC:
The room is a large cavern full of broken stone. The walls are
scorched and there are deep scratches on the floor. A sooty dry smell
is very strong here. A paved path winds from a large passage to the
west, through the room, and across a huge stone bridge
to the south. To the east a small crack is visible. A dark and
smokey tunnel leads north.
NORTH: The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.
IN: The dragon hisses at you and blocks your way.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM DRAGON-LAIR (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are in the dragon's lair, where the rock walls are scarred by flame.
A blackened doorway leads to the south.") (DESC "Dragon's Lair") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (SOUTH TO DRAGON-ROOM) (OUT TO DRAGON-ROOM))
Name: DRAGON-LAIR

LDESC:
You are in the dragon's lair, where the rock walls are scarred by flame.
A blackened doorway leads to the south.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM FRESCO-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "A path leads east-west through a room decorated with beautiful frescoes
of someone battling dragons and rescuing fair maidens. It is hard
to tell who is doing this as those parts of the
frescoes have been blackened and cracked by intense heat.") (DESC "Fresco Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (EAST TO DRAGON-ROOM) (WEST TO BANK-ENTRANCE))
Name: FRESCO-ROOM

LDESC:
A path leads east-west through a room decorated with beautiful frescoes
of someone battling dragons and rescuing fair maidens. It is hard
to tell who is doing this as those parts of the
frescoes have been blackened and cracked by intense heat.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM STONE-BRIDGE (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the middle of a ruined but still impressive stone bridge
spanning a deep chasm. Water flows far beneath. A paved path leads
north into a large open space. To the south, the path leads into a misty
tunnel.") (DESC "Stone Bridge") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO DRAGON-ROOM) (SOUTH TO COOL-ROOM) (DOWN "It's a long way down.") (CROSS "You'll have to specify a direction.") (GLOBAL BRIDGE CHASM))
Name: STONE-BRIDGE

CROSS.MESSAGE: You'll have to specify a direction.

LDESC:
This is the middle of a ruined but still impressive stone bridge
spanning a deep chasm. Water flows far beneath. A paved path leads
north into a large open space. To the south, the path leads into a misty
tunnel.
CROSS: You'll have to specify a direction.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM COOL-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "The room is cool and damp. The air is misty. A twisty path from the
southeast splits here toward a wide northerly stone bridge, and a narrow
westerly tunnel. It is from the latter
that the mist and chill seem to originate.") (DESC "Cool Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (SE TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (NORTH TO STONE-BRIDGE) (WEST TO GLACIER-ROOM) (CROSS TO STONE-BRIDGE) (GLOBAL BRIDGE))
Name: COOL-ROOM

LDESC:
The room is cool and damp. The air is misty. A twisty path from the
southeast splits here toward a wide northerly stone bridge, and a narrow
westerly tunnel. It is from the latter
that the mist and chill seem to originate.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM GLACIER-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Ice Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (EAST TO COOL-ROOM) (WEST TO LAVA-ROOM IF ICE-MELTED ELSE "You don't even have an ice-pick.") (UP TO LAVA-TUBE) (ACTION GLACIER-ROOM-FCN))
Name: GLACIER-ROOM

WEST.ELSE: You don't even have an ice-pick.
WEST.Zil: (WEST TO LAVA-ROOM IF ICE-MELTED ELSE "You don't even have an ice-pick.")

WEST: You don't even have an ice-pick.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM LAVA-TUBE (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are in a tight chimney of solidified lava. It extends up at
least another hundred feet and down to a large room far below. A large
crack opens to the south, probably the result of a shift
in the rock strata.") (DESC "Lava Tube") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (DOWN TO GLACIER-ROOM) (UP TO VOLCANO-VIEW) (SOUTH TO COBWEBBY-CORRIDOR) (PSEUDO "CRACK" LT-CRACK-PSEUDO))
Name: LAVA-TUBE

LDESC:
You are in a tight chimney of solidified lava. It extends up at
least another hundred feet and down to a large room far below. A large
crack opens to the south, probably the result of a shift
in the rock strata.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM COBWEBBY-CORRIDOR (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "A winding corridor is filled with cobwebs. Some
are broken and the dust on the floor is disturbed. The trend of the
twists and turns is northeast to southwest. On the north side of one
twist, high up, is a narrow crack.") (DESC "Cobwebby Corridor") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (IN TO LAVA-TUBE) (UP TO LAVA-TUBE) (NORTH TO LAVA-TUBE) (NE TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (SW TO GUARDIAN-ROOM) (DOWN TO GUARDIAN-ROOM) (PSEUDO "CRACK" CC-CRACK-PSEUDO))
Name: COBWEBBY-CORRIDOR

LDESC:
A winding corridor is filled with cobwebs. Some
are broken and the dust on the floor is disturbed. The trend of the
twists and turns is northeast to southwest. On the north side of one
twist, high up, is a narrow crack.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM ROOM-8 (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a small chamber carved out of the rock at the end of a short crawl.
On the wall is crudely chiseled the number \"8\".") (DESC "Room 8") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (EAST TO CAROUSEL-ROOM))
Name: ROOM-8

LDESC:
This is a small chamber carved out of the rock at the end of a short crawl.
On the wall is crudely chiseled the number "8".

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM MENHIR-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (DESC "Menhir Room") (LDESC " ") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (SW TO KENNEL IF MENHIR-POSITION ELSE "You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.") (SOUTH TO STAIRWAY-TOP) (ACTION MENHIR-ROOM-FCN) (GLOBAL MENHIR))
Name: MENHIR-ROOM

SW.ELSE: You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.
SW.Zil: (SW TO KENNEL IF MENHIR-POSITION ELSE "You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.")

SW: You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM KENNEL (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This room looks like it was once a kennel for a very large dog (some of
the bones would fit a dinosaur). It apparently hasn't been used for a
long time, as the dust is fairly thick all over. The only
exit is northeast.") (DESC "Kennel") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NE TO MENHIR-ROOM IF MENHIR-POSITION ELSE "You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.") (OUT TO MENHIR-ROOM IF MENHIR-POSITION ELSE "You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.") (GLOBAL MENHIR))
Name: KENNEL

NE.ELSE: You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.
NE.Zil: (NE TO MENHIR-ROOM IF MENHIR-POSITION ELSE "You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.")

OUT.ELSE: You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.
OUT.Zil: (OUT TO MENHIR-ROOM IF MENHIR-POSITION ELSE "You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.")

LDESC:
This room looks like it was once a kennel for a very large dog (some of
the bones would fit a dinosaur). It apparently hasn't been used for a
long time, as the dust is fairly thick all over. The only
exit is northeast.
NE: You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.
OUT: You are trying to walk through an enormous rock.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM STAIRWAY-TOP (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "A marble stairway leads down into the gloom and a passage leads north.") (DESC "Stairway") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (DOWN TO DIAMOND-5) (NORTH TO MENHIR-ROOM) (GLOBAL STAIRS))
Name: STAIRWAY-TOP

LDESC: A marble stairway leads down into the gloom and a passage leads north.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM DIAMOND-1 (IN ROOMS) (DESC "Oddly-angled Room") (LDESC "A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (SE TO DIAMOND-5) (ACTION DIAMOND-MOTION) (GLOBAL DWINDOW))
Name: DIAMOND-1

LDESC: A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.

Name: DIAMOND-3

LDESC: A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.

(FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NW TO DIAMOND-1) (NORTH TO DIAMOND-2) (NE TO DIAMOND-3) (WEST TO DIAMOND-4) (EAST TO DIAMOND-6) (SW TO DIAMOND-7) (SOUTH TO DIAMOND-8) (SE TO DIAMOND-9) (DOWN TO CERBERUS-ROOM) (UP TO STAIRWAY-TOP) (ACTION DIAMOND-MOTION) (GLOBAL STAIRS DWINDOW))

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM DIAMOND-6 (IN ROOMS) (DESC "Oddly-angled Room") (LDESC "A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (WEST TO DIAMOND-5) (NW TO DIAMOND-2) (SW TO DIAMOND-8) (ACTION DIAMOND-MOTION) (GLOBAL DWINDOW))
Name: DIAMOND-6

LDESC: A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM DIAMOND-7 (IN ROOMS) (DESC "Oddly-angled Room") (LDESC "A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NE TO DIAMOND-5) (ACTION DIAMOND-MOTION) (GLOBAL DWINDOW))
Name: DIAMOND-7

LDESC: A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM DIAMOND-8 (IN ROOMS) (DESC "Oddly-angled Room") (LDESC "A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO DIAMOND-5) (NW TO DIAMOND-4) (NE TO DIAMOND-6) (ACTION DIAMOND-MOTION) (GLOBAL DWINDOW))
Name: DIAMOND-8

LDESC: A small room with oddly angled walls and passages in all directions.

up from a gateway arch.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM WIZARDS-WORKSHOP (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the workshop of the Wizard of Frobozz.") (DESC "Wizard's Workshop") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO GUARDIAN-ROOM IF WIZ-DOOR IS OPEN) (OUT TO GUARDIAN-ROOM IF WIZ-DOOR IS OPEN) (WEST TO WORKBENCH-ROOM) (SOUTH TO TROPHY-ROOM) (ACTION WORKSHOP-FCN) (VALUE 10) (GLOBAL WIZ-DOOR))

OUT.Zil: (OUT TO GUARDIAN-ROOM IF WIZ-DOOR IS OPEN)

LDESC: This is the workshop of the Wizard of Frobozz.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM WORKBENCH-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This room is the Wizard's workroom. A hall continues east and west,
and a larger room lies to the south. There are many shelves and racks
on the walls, but the Wizard's workbench dominates the room. It is made
of dark, heavy wood bound with iron. The workbench is stained from many
years of use, and is deeply gouged as though some huge clawed animal was
imprisoned on it. There are burn marks and even notes written in a crabbed
hand. Many arcane items are scattered about the bench; alembics, mortar
and pestle, small knives of various sizes, odd scraps of vellum, wax
candles, and much more. In the center of a relatively clear area of the
bench are affixed three stands - ruby, sapphire, and diamond - which form
a triangle.") (DESC "Wizard's Workroom") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (EAST TO WIZARDS-WORKSHOP) (SOUTH TO PENTAGRAM-ROOM) (WEST TO AQUARIUM-ROOM) (PSEUDO "MORTAR" ARCANA-PSEUDO "PESTLE" ARCANA-PSEUDO))
Name: WORKBENCH-ROOM

LDESC:
This room is the Wizard's workroom. A hall continues east and west,
and a larger room lies to the south. There are many shelves and racks
on the walls, but the Wizard's workbench dominates the room. It is made
of dark, heavy wood bound with iron. The workbench is stained from many
years of use, and is deeply gouged as though some huge clawed animal was
imprisoned on it. There are burn marks and even notes written in a crabbed
hand. Many arcane items are scattered about the bench; alembics, mortar
and pestle, small knives of various sizes, odd scraps of vellum, wax
candles, and much more. In the center of a relatively clear area of the
bench are affixed three stands - ruby, sapphire, and diamond - which form
a triangle.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM TROPHY-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the Wizard's trophy room, filled with memorabilia of various
sorts. On one wall is the Wizard's D. T. (Doctor of Thaumaturgy) degree
from GUE Tech. Several old magic wands are mounted on a wand rack. A
collection of dull and nicked swords testify to the fate of many
foolhardy adventurers. Small bottles contain discarded homunculi (a few
preserved in alcohol). There is a stuffed owl on a perch.") (DESC "Trophy Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO WIZARDS-WORKSHOP) (PSEUDO "OWL" TROPHY-PSEUDO "HOMUNCULI" TROPHY-PSEUDO))
Name: TROPHY-ROOM

LDESC:
This is the Wizard's trophy room, filled with memorabilia of various
sorts. On one wall is the Wizard's D. T. (Doctor of Thaumaturgy) degree
from GUE Tech. Several old magic wands are mounted on a wand rack. A
collection of dull and nicked swords testify to the fate of many
foolhardy adventurers. Small bottles contain discarded homunculi (a few
preserved in alcohol). There is a stuffed owl on a perch.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM PENTAGRAM-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "In this room, inscribed on the floor, is a great pentagram drawn with
black chalk. In its center is a black circle.") (DESC "Pentagram Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (NORTH TO WORKBENCH-ROOM) (GLOBAL GLOBAL-MENHIR GLOBAL-CERBERUS GLOBAL-WIZARD-CASE))
Name: PENTAGRAM-ROOM

LDESC:
In this room, inscribed on the floor, is a great pentagram drawn with
black chalk. In its center is a black circle.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM AQUARIUM-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "Here a dark hallway turns a corner. To the south is a dark room, to
the east is fitful light.") (DESC "Aquarium Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (EAST TO WORKBENCH-ROOM) (IN TO IN-AQUARIUM) (SOUTH TO WIZARDS-QUARTERS))
Name: AQUARIUM-ROOM

LDESC:
Here a dark hallway turns a corner. To the south is a dark room, to
the east is fitful light.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM IN-AQUARIUM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "The floor here seems to be made of sand, but it is hard to see anything
else.") (DESC "Murky Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (OUT TO AQUARIUM-ROOM) (ACTION IN-AQUARIUM-FCN))
Name: IN-AQUARIUM

LDESC:
The floor here seems to be made of sand, but it is hard to see anything
else.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM WIZARDS-QUARTERS (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Wizard's Quarters") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO AQUARIUM-ROOM) (ACTION WIZARD-QUARTERS-FCN))
Name: WIZARDS-QUARTERS

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM CAROUSEL-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Carousel Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (NORTH TO MARBLE-HALL) (NE TO STREAM-PATH) (EAST TO TOPIARY-ROOM) (SE TO RIDDLE-ROOM) (SOUTH TO MENHIR-ROOM) (SW TO COBWEBBY-CORRIDOR) (WEST TO ROOM-8) (NW TO COOL-ROOM) (ACTION CAROUSEL-ROOM-FCN))
Name: CAROUSEL-ROOM

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM RIDDLE-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Riddle Room") (DOWN TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (NW TO CAROUSEL-ROOM) (EAST TO PEARL-ROOM IF RIDDLE-DOOR IS OPEN) (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (ACTION RIDDLE-ROOM-FCN) (PSEUDO "RIDDLE" RIDDLE-PSEUDO))
Name: RIDDLE-ROOM

EAST.Zil: (EAST TO PEARL-ROOM IF RIDDLE-DOOR IS OPEN)

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM PEARL-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a former broom closet. The exits are to the east and west.") (DESC "Pearl Room") (EAST TO WELL-BOTTOM) (WEST TO RIDDLE-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: PEARL-ROOM

LDESC: This is a former broom closet. The exits are to the east and west.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM VOLCANO-BOTTOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are at the bottom of a large dormant volcano. High above you
light enters from the cone of the volcano. The only exit is to the north.") (DESC "Volcano Bottom") (NORTH TO LAVA-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT NONLANDBIT))
Name: VOLCANO-BOTTOM

LDESC:
You are at the bottom of a large dormant volcano. High above you
light enters from the cone of the volcano. The only exit is to the north.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM VAIR-1 (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are about one hundred feet above the bottom of the volcano. The
top of the volcano is clearly visible here.") (DESC "Volcano Core") (FLAGS NONLANDBIT NWALLBIT))
Name: VAIR-1

LDESC:
You are about one hundred feet above the bottom of the volcano. The
top of the volcano is clearly visible here.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM VAIR-2 (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are about two hundred feet above the volcano floor. Looming
above is the rim of the volcano. There is a small ledge on the west
side.") (DESC "Volcano Near Small Ledge") (WEST TO LEDGE-1) (LAND TO LEDGE-1) (FLAGS NONLANDBIT NWALLBIT))
Name: VAIR-2

LDESC:
You are about two hundred feet above the volcano floor. Looming
above is the rim of the volcano. There is a small ledge on the west
side.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM VAIR-3 (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are high above the floor of the volcano. The rim of the volcano
looks very narrow and you are very near it. To the
east is what appears to be a viewing ledge, too thin to land on.") (DESC "Volcano by Viewing Ledge") (FLAGS NONLANDBIT NWALLBIT))
Name: VAIR-3

LDESC:
You are high above the floor of the volcano. The rim of the volcano
looks very narrow and you are very near it. To the
east is what appears to be a viewing ledge, too thin to land on.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM VAIR-4 (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are near the rim of the volcano. Above you it is open to the sky.
To the west, there is a place to land on a wide ledge.") (DESC "Volcano Near Wide Ledge") (LAND TO LEDGE-2) (WEST TO LEDGE-2) (FLAGS NONLANDBIT NWALLBIT))
Name: VAIR-4

LDESC:
You are near the rim of the volcano. Above you it is open to the sky.
To the west, there is a place to land on a wide ledge.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM LEDGE-1 (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are on a narrow ledge within an old dormant volcano. This ledge is
about halfway between the floor below and the rim above. There is an exit
to the south.") (DESC "Narrow Ledge") (DOWN "I wouldn't jump from here.") (WEST TO VOLCANO-BOTTOM IF GNOME-DOOR-FLAG) (SOUTH TO LIBRARY) (FLAGS RLANDBIT NONLANDBIT))
Name: LEDGE-1

LDESC:
You are on a narrow ledge within an old dormant volcano. This ledge is
about halfway between the floor below and the rim above. There is an exit
to the south.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM LIBRARY (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This must have been a large library, probably for the royal family. All
of the shelves have been gnawed to pieces by unfriendly gnomes. To the
north is an exit.") (DESC "Library") (NORTH TO LEDGE-1) (OUT TO LEDGE-1) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: LIBRARY

LDESC:
This must have been a large library, probably for the royal family. All
of the shelves have been gnawed to pieces by unfriendly gnomes. To the
north is an exit.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM VOLCANO-VIEW (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are on a ledge in the middle of a large volcano. Below you
the volcano bottom can be seen and above is the rim of the volcano.
A couple of ledges can be seen on the other side of the volcano;
it appears that this ledge is intermediate in elevation between
those on the other side. The exit from this room is to the east.") (DESC "Volcano View") (DOWN "I wouldn't try that.") (CROSS "It is impossible to cross this distance.") (EAST TO LAVA-TUBE) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: VOLCANO-VIEW

CROSS.MESSAGE: It is impossible to cross this distance.
CROSS.Zil: (CROSS "It is impossible to cross this distance.")

LDESC:
You are on a ledge in the middle of a large volcano. Below you
the volcano bottom can be seen and above is the rim of the volcano.
A couple of ledges can be seen on the other side of the volcano;
it appears that this ledge is intermediate in elevation between
those on the other side. The exit from this room is to the east.
CROSS: It is impossible to cross this distance.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM LEDGE-2 (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Wide Ledge") (DOWN "It's a long way down.") (WEST TO VOLCANO-BOTTOM IF GNOME-DOOR-FLAG) (SOUTH TO SAFE-ROOM) (ACTION LEDGE-FCN) (FLAGS RLANDBIT NONLANDBIT))
Name: LEDGE-2

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM SAFE-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Dusty Room") (NORTH TO LEDGE-2) (ACTION SAFE-ROOM-FCN) (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT))
Name: SAFE-ROOM

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM LAVA-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a small room, whose walls are formed by an old lava flow.
There are exits here to the east and the south.") (DESC "Lava Room") (SOUTH TO VOLCANO-BOTTOM) (EAST TO GLACIER-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: LAVA-ROOM

LDESC:
This is a small room, whose walls are formed by an old lava flow.
There are exits here to the east and the south.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM MAGNET-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Low Room") (NORTH PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (SOUTH PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (WEST PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (NE PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (NW PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (SW PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (SE PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (EAST PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (OUT PER MAGNET-ROOM-EXIT) (ACTION MAGNET-ROOM-FCN) (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT))
Name: MAGNET-ROOM

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM MACHINE-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a large room full of assorted heavy machinery, whirring noisily.
The room smells of burned resistors. Along one wall are three buttons
which are, respectively, round, triangular, and square. Naturally,
above these buttons are instructions written in EBCDIC. A large sign
in English above all the buttons says|
       \"DANGER -- HIGH VOLTAGE\"|
There are exits to the west and the south.") (DESC "Machine Room") (WEST TO MAGNET-ROOM) (SOUTH TO CAGE-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT))
Name: MACHINE-ROOM

LDESC:
This is a large room full of assorted heavy machinery, whirring noisily.
The room smells of burned resistors. Along one wall are three buttons
which are, respectively, round, triangular, and square. Naturally,
above these buttons are instructions written in EBCDIC. A large sign
in English above all the buttons says|
       "DANGER -- HIGH VOLTAGE"|
There are exits to the west and the south.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM CAGE-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a dingy closet adjacent to a larger room to the north.
Chiselled into a wall are these words:|
|
     Protected by|
       FROBOZZ|
 Magic Alarm Company|
  (Hello, footpad!)||
There doesn't seem to be any footpad here, however.") (DESC "Dingy Closet") (OUT TO MACHINE-ROOM) (NORTH TO MACHINE-ROOM) (FLAGS ONBIT RLANDBIT))
Name: CAGE-ROOM

LDESC:
This is a dingy closet adjacent to a larger room to the north.
Chiselled into a wall are these words:|
|
     Protected by|
       FROBOZZ|
 Magic Alarm Company|
  (Hello, footpad!)||
There doesn't seem to be any footpad here, however.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM IN-CAGE (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are trapped inside a solid steel cage.") (DESC "Cage") (ACTION IN-CAGE-FCN) (FLAGS RLANDBIT NWALLBIT ONBIT))
Name: IN-CAGE

LDESC: You are trapped inside a solid steel cage.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM WELL-TOP (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "You are at the top of the well. Well done. There are etchings on
the side of the well. There is a small crack across the floor at the
entrance to a room on the east, but it can be crossed easily.") (DESC "Top of Well") (EAST TO TEA-ROOM) (DOWN "It's a long way down!") (FLAGS RLANDBIT NONLANDBIT) (VALUE 10) (GLOBAL WELL) (PSEUDO "CRACK" CRACK-PSEUDO))
Name: WELL-TOP

LDESC:
You are at the top of the well. Well done. There are etchings on
the side of the well. There is a small crack across the floor at the
entrance to a room on the east, but it can be crossed easily.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM WELL-BOTTOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a damp circular room, whose walls are made of brick and
mortar. The roof of this room is not visible, but there appear to be
some etchings on the walls. There is a passageway to the west.") (DESC "Circular Room") (WEST TO PEARL-ROOM) (UP "The walls cannot be climbed.") (FLAGS RLANDBIT NONLANDBIT) (GLOBAL WELL))
Name: WELL-BOTTOM

LDESC:
This is a damp circular room, whose walls are made of brick and
mortar. The roof of this room is not visible, but there appear to be
some etchings on the walls. There is a passageway to the west.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM TEA-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a small room containing a large oblong table, no doubt set
for afternoon tea. It is clear from the
objects on the table that the users were indeed mad. In the eastern
corner of the room is a small hole (no more than four inches high).
There are passageways leading away to the west and the northwest.") (DESC "Tea Room") (EAST "Only a mouse could get in there.") (WEST TO WELL-TOP) (NW TO MAGNET-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (PSEUDO "HOLE" ALICE-HOLE))
Name: TEA-ROOM

EAST.MESSAGE: Only a mouse could get in there.
EAST.Zil: (EAST "Only a mouse could get in there.")

LDESC:
This is a small room containing a large oblong table, no doubt set
for afternoon tea. It is clear from the
objects on the table that the users were indeed mad. In the eastern
corner of the room is a small hole (no more than four inches high).
There are passageways leading away to the west and the northwest.
EAST: Only a mouse could get in there.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM POSTS-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is an enormous room, in the center of which are four wooden
posts delineating a rectangular area, above which is what appears to
be a wooden roof. In fact, all objects in this room appear to be
abnormally large. To the east is a passageway. There are large gaping
chasms to the west and northwest.") (DESC "Posts Room") (NW "A great chasm blocks your way.") (EAST TO POOL-ROOM) (WEST "A great chasm blocks your way.") (DOWN "A great chasm blocks your way.") (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (ACTION POSTS-ROOM-FCN) (GLOBAL CHASM))
Name: POSTS-ROOM

NW.MESSAGE: A great chasm blocks your way.

WEST.MESSAGE: A great chasm blocks your way.

DOWN.MESSAGE: A great chasm blocks your way.

LDESC:
This is an enormous room, in the center of which are four wooden
posts delineating a rectangular area, above which is what appears to
be a wooden roof. In fact, all objects in this room appear to be
abnormally large. To the east is a passageway. There are large gaping
chasms to the west and northwest.
NW: A great chasm blocks your way.
WEST: A great chasm blocks your way.
DOWN: A great chasm blocks your way.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM POOL-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a large room, one half of which is depressed. Salty water flows
from a large leak in the ceiling. The only exit is to the west.") (DESC "Pool Room") (OUT TO POSTS-ROOM) (WEST TO POSTS-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: POOL-ROOM

LDESC:
This is a large room, one half of which is depressed. Salty water flows
from a large leak in the ceiling. The only exit is to the west.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM BANK-ENTRANCE (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the entrance hall of the Bank of Zork, the largest
banking institution of the Great Underground Empire. A partial
account of its history is in \"The Lives of the Twelve Flatheads,\" in
the chapter on J. Pierpont Flathead. A more detailed history (albeit
less objective) may be found in Flathead's outrageous autobiography
\"I'm Rich and You Aren't - So There!\".
Most of the furniture has been ravaged by passing scavengers. All
that remains are two signs at the northwest and northeast corners of
the room, which say:|
|
    <--  VIEWING ROOMS  -->|
|
The way out (ornate but tasteful) is to the east.
") (DESC "Bank Entrance") (NW TO TELLER-WEST) (NE TO TELLER-EAST) (EAST TO FRESCO-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: BANK-ENTRANCE

LDESC:
This is the entrance hall of the Bank of Zork, the largest
banking institution of the Great Underground Empire. A partial
account of its history is in "The Lives of the Twelve Flatheads," in
the chapter on J. Pierpont Flathead. A more detailed history (albeit
less objective) may be found in Flathead's outrageous autobiography
"I'm Rich and You Aren't - So There!".
Most of the furniture has been ravaged by passing scavengers. All
that remains are two signs at the northwest and northeast corners of
the room, which say:|
|
    <--  VIEWING ROOMS  -->|
|
The way out (ornate but tasteful) is to the east.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM TELLER-WEST (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "West Teller's Room") (NORTH TO VIEWING-WEST) (SOUTH TO BANK-ENTRANCE) (WEST TO DEPOSITORY) (ACTION TELLER-ROOM) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: TELLER-WEST

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM VIEWING-WEST (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This room was used by holders of safety deposit boxes to view
their contents. On the north side of the room is a sign which says:|
|
\"Remain here while the teller retrieves your safety deposit box.
When you are finished, leave the box, and exit to the south.
Safety deposit boxes cannot be removed from this room!|
|
Thank You for Banking at the Zork!\"
") (DESC "West Viewing Room") (SOUTH TO BANK-ENTRANCE) (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (GLOBAL SEWL SWWL SNWL SSWL))
Name: VIEWING-WEST

LDESC:
This room was used by holders of safety deposit boxes to view
their contents. On the north side of the room is a sign which says:|
|
"Remain here while the teller retrieves your safety deposit box.
When you are finished, leave the box, and exit to the south.
Safety deposit boxes cannot be removed from this room!|
|
Thank You for Banking at the Zork!"

|

#OBJECT (ROOM SMALL-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a small, bare room with no distinguishing features. There
are no exits from this room.") (DESC "Small Room") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (GLOBAL SEWL SWWL SNWL SSWL))

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM VAULT (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is the Vault of the Bank of Zork, in which there are no doors.") (DESC "Vault") (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (GLOBAL SEWL SWWL SNWL SSWL))

LDESC: This is the Vault of the Bank of Zork, in which there are no doors.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM DEPOSITORY (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This is a large rectangular room. The east and west walls were used
for storing safety deposit boxes, but all have been carefully removed
by evil persons. To the east, west, and south of the room are large
doorways. The northern \"wall\" of the room is a shimmering curtain of
light. In the center of the room is a large stone cube, about 10 feet
on a side. Engraved on the side of the cube is some lettering.") (DESC "Safety Depository") (NORTH "There is a curtain of light there.") (WEST PER BKLEAVEW) (EAST PER BKLEAVEE) (SOUTH TO OFFICE) (ACTION DEPOSITORY-FCN) (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (GLOBAL SNWL))
Name: DEPOSITORY

NORTH.MESSAGE: There is a curtain of light there.
NORTH.Zil: (NORTH "There is a curtain of light there.")

LDESC:
This is a large rectangular room. The east and west walls were used
for storing safety deposit boxes, but all have been carefully removed
by evil persons. To the east, west, and south of the room are large
doorways. The northern "wall" of the room is a shimmering curtain of
light. In the center of the room is a large stone cube, about 10 feet
on a side. Engraved on the side of the cube is some lettering.
NORTH: There is a curtain of light there.

Zil:
#OBJECT (ROOM OFFICE (IN ROOMS) (LDESC "This room was the office of the Chairman of the Bank of Zork.
Like the other rooms here, it has been extensively vandalized.
The lone exit is to the north.") (DESC "Chairman's Office") (NORTH TO DEPOSITORY) (FLAGS RLANDBIT))
Name: OFFICE

LDESC:
This room was the office of the Chairman of the Bank of Zork.
Like the other rooms here, it has been extensively vandalized.
The lone exit is to the north.

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM DREARY-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Dreary Room") (SOUTH TO TINY-ROOM IF PDOOR IS OPEN) (OUT TO TINY-ROOM IF PDOOR IS OPEN) (ACTION DREARY-ROOM-FCN) (FLAGS RLANDBIT ONBIT) (GLOBAL PDOOR PWINDOW))
Name: DREARY-ROOM

Zil: #OBJECT (ROOM TINY-ROOM (IN ROOMS) (LDESC " ") (DESC "Tiny Room") (NORTH TO DREARY-ROOM IF PDOOR IS OPEN) (IN TO DREARY-ROOM IF PDOOR IS OPEN) (DOWN TO RAVINE-LEDGE) (FLAGS RLANDBIT) (ACTION TINY-ROOM-FCN) (GLOBAL PDOOR PWINDOW CHASM))
Name: TINY-ROOM

NORTH.Zil: (NORTH TO DREARY-ROOM IF PDOOR IS OPEN)

IN.Zil: (IN TO DREARY-ROOM IF PDOOR IS OPEN)
